intro: Convolvulus recurvatus subsp. recurvatus, commonly known as the slender morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, funnel-shaped flowers that are usually pale blue to purple in color, blooming in the morning. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
